file_content.text: I saw one of the HK units follow you out. The sooner they're all recovered, the sooner I can go home.
Before Hoth, I was stationed on Dromund Kaas. Climate controlled and civilized.
Your records, General. Now at least the mystery is solved.
You work well together. I sent three squads in, and they crumpled like a house of pazaak cards. Let's hope it was worth something.
Thank you, my lord. Many an Imperial will sleep easier tonight. Everything looks to be in order.
Excellent! The moment I saw you, I knew you could be relied on. Let's see what all the fuss was about.
I've never heard of these HK droids.
HK droids?
With one HK droid, the Empire could make fast work of a troublesome Jedi or Republic leader. With an army, we would be unstoppable.
Sounds like the HKs and I were meant to find each other.
I sense things will work out.
I enjoy discovering new toys.
This will be fun.
I'll find a way to make it pay off.
Good enough.
The Fatality's cargo is top secret. Just imagine what kind of weapon might be down there....
It's about time! I requested a heat source and a medic hours ago. Unless you're dying or dead, I--
You're not my reinforcements. Apologies. If you'd been through what we have, you'd be a little jumpy, too.
Same cold, same ice. Notice us not complaining.
Speak for yourself.
You and your squad of scarecrows don't look worth attacking.
You're not much of a target.
We're lucky to be alive. Half my men are at the bottom of that wreck.
I'm armed and in a lot better shape than you.
Doesn't mean I can't help.
I'll put you out of your misery, if you like.
Stop whining, or else.
That won't be necessary. I'd like to live to see what's so special about a crashed ship.
High Command believes the Fatality's cargo is so important, they won't even tell me what it is. I'm just supposed to find it.
The Fatality's classified records will tell us what the cargo is. I don't suppose...?
Cargo worth dying for? This I have to see.
Yes. You've intrigued me.
No chance.
If you reach an Imperial outpost, send reinforcements our way. Or at least a medic.
Dread Master legions... only thing worse than this cold....
My lord! I didn't recognize you. We're wounded, freezing and warding off attacks from the Dread Masters' forces.
Wait, you can't be my reinforcements. Imperial Intelligence is disbanded... isn't it?
No... this isn't right. They wouldn't send a bounty hunter to aid us. Not even a Great Hunt Grand Champion.
Point taken. I guarantee you'll be compensated for any assistance you provide.
That's on a need-to-know basis, General. The point is, I'm here--and curious why you are.
Your question is irrelevant.
My mission is to reclaim a death trap. It's going about as well as you'd expect.
Tell me your mission.
I'll warn you in advance: my intel is far from complete.
Years ago, when the Dread Masters were first imprisoned here, one of their apprentices stole the Imperial destroyer "Fatality." We never learned why.
The Fatality was believed lost--until we discovered the Dread Masters excavating its wreck from the ice here. High Command sent me to recover the vessel.
How did a ship lost decades ago crash on a Republic prison planet we only recently learned existed?
It shouldn't be on Belsavis.
That's a lot of wasted resources. What's so special about the Fatality?
What's the point?
There must be something very special aboard the Fatality if the Dread Masters are throwing forces at it.
The Dread Masters have a plan.
Most likely, the Dread Masters' apprentice was attempting to free them on his own. Apparently, he almost succeeded.
Apparently the answer is above my rank.
The elements feel a bit harsher after you've barely escaped the Dread Masters' forces.
But we weren't prepared for the savages inside that vessel. The Dread Master legions are led by a Houk. He keeps our dead as frozen trophies.
Then consider acquiring the information a favor--one for which you'll be well-compensated.
We'll hold this position. Enter the Fatality, eliminate the enemy forces and their Houk leader, then find out what's inside that ship. Good luck.
The Dread Masters and their servants will learn the price of betraying the Empire. Give me coordinates to the Fatality--I'll handle this.
Not for long--I'm going in.
While you're in there, access the Fatality's classified records. That should clear up this little mystery.
You're more than welcome to express my embarrassment to that giant Houk.
Getting inside the ship is easy. It's killing everyone there that's giving us trouble.
I can find a technician to reactivate the droids, but we'll need detailed schematics and suitable repair parts.
That seems only fair--and blast High Command if it disagrees.
Just imagine what our enemy could do with them now.
They sound dangerous.
No wonder that apprentice stole the Fatality all those years ago. He could've easily freed the Dread Masters with HK droids for his army.
The Dread Masters must never be allowed to possess those droids--but destroying them is not an option.
It doesn't look like they ever got to leave the ship. What do you think happened?
How did they fail?
Clearly, Republic forces shot down the Fatality when it arrived at Belsavis. Why they never recovered the wreck remains a mystery--but no matter.
Incredible! The Fatality was crewed with fully-functioning HK droids! I'd heard rumors of a project decades back, but never imagined it was real.
You'll never find a more lethal assassin. A functioning HK hasn't been seen in the galaxy for centuries.
Records indicate the droids were all damaged and deactivated in the crash. To fix them, we need spare parts that may not even exist.
I'm not giving up yet.
If I were to acquire these nonexistent parts, I'd expect one of those droids as payment.
Give me one, and I'll help.
There must be a way.
If you're telling me I just fought my way through that vessel for nothing, the Dread Masters will be the least of your worries.
You've wasted my time, fool.
Czerka Corporation created the HK droids. One of their laboratory archives might contain a complete set of schematics. Not much, but it's a start.
I've accomplished more with less.
That's all I need.
Our odds of success go up if we work together to find these things.
Are you planning to help?
Keep an eye on the Fatality. I don't want the Dread Masters or Republic forces getting in while I'm gone.
Stay here and guard the wreck.
High Command said the same. We'll do our best.
There's a place you could look that won't involve any negotiations with Czerka. Try there first--and good luck!
My orders are to keep the Fatality under constant surveillance. Believe me, I'd much rather go with you.
I still have no medic or heat source--but better cold and alive than executed for my failure.
I found everything we need to repair those HK droids.
Brilliant! And I have a chief engineer on standby. He's a bit twitchy, but knows his way around a droid.
I'll send him in behind you to repair one of the HKs, but I'm afraid a new problem has cropped up in your absence.
Dread Master forces have once again taken over the Fatality. Their leader is a powerful Sith calling himself the Lord of Agony.
There is no Sith more powerful than the Emperor's Wrath.
He is mistaken.
That fool is about to learn the true meaning of agony--in excruciating detail.
He shouldn't have crossed me.
If that Sith is as stupid as his fancy title, I'll enjoy torching him.
That's a dumb name.
They know we have what's needed to reactivate the droids. They're hoping to take it from our corpses.
The enemy is cunning.
If the droids were stolen by the Dread Masters' apprentice, will they attack us once they're reactivated?
I'm more worried about the HK.
Your only job was to secure that crash site until I returned!
You failed again!
I lost almost a hundred men to that Sith and his followers. We're not equipped to fight anyone like him.
My chief engineer is awaiting word that you've retaken the Fatality. He'll meet you inside when all enemy forces are dead.
According to the records you recovered, none of the HK units were reprogrammed. They remain loyal Imperial servants. Still... be careful.
I trust you won't permit them that convenience.
Indeed. The Fatality could use some flames to brighten up the place.
I regret I won't be present to witness the lesson.
I tried explaining that to him, but he's not what one would call a brilliant conversationalist.
Give him everything you've acquired, and he'll repair the HK droid for you. Best of luck.
Nothing we can do for the dead, but I'd prefer to keep living. I can't do that if the mission fails.
Don't expect me to shed tears for your men. Dying is what soldiers are for.
I have no sympathy.
You're telling me the Empire's best soldiers can't take down a single Houk?
He's just another alien brute.
I don't care about the cargo--I want that Houk scum dead.
I'm just in it for the fight.
